data.name: Arcade
data.description:
Welcome to Arcade!

* 5 ready retro style games : Galactics, Bricks, Blocks, Invasions and Match!
* More games to come (next one: Rocs)
* Support all frame rate frequencies from 72.0 Hz to 120 Hz
* 4 levels of difficulties (easy, medium, hard & expert)
* 20 to 75 waves per game (depending of the game)
* Vector style graphics
* Original soundtracks
* And a leaderboard to share your score across players

I hope you will have a lot of fun playing Arcade ;-)

NeoPunk

Hello Folks!
Here a new version of Arcade!

What's new?
Mainly Theme & Mailbox

Theme: variations of a game (ex. levels)
It's a start, but the concept will improve over time.
For the moment, it's 2 additionnal themes for Match: Christmas & Emoji!

Mailbox: a way to give you some infos. Kindo of messages repository.

Enjoy!

NeoPunk!

Hello Folk!

Hello people !

Since I don't know if I will have time to release a new major update before the end of the year, I decided to offer you a very small update to improve your experience!

I guess some people have been waiting for it, and many (like me) will appreciate it!

Now when you pause the game, you have the option to abort and immediately replay without going through the menu again.

Very cool for Match games  :-)

In addition, in the event of a game over, the return to the menu is much faster, allowing you to replay very quickly.

Let me know what to you think there: www.neopunk.xyz

Welcome to Match the new game!

My next regular game will take some months to code, but I wanted to release something before the end of the year.
So I here is Match, the litle sister of Blocks.

Unlike other games in Arcade, Match is a blitz game.
It means that whatever the level of difficulty, it should not last more than 3 minutes.

So it's a good way to test reflexes and synchronization!
And It's addictive...

Find the details and rules here:
https://neopunk.xyz/index.php?page=Games&games_detail=Match

Hello folks!

This is the version 3.0 of Arcade.

Having received many positive comments and some ideas for improvements, I decided to delay (few weeks) the release of the next game: Blended.

So I focused my development on improving the user experience, making some major changes:
* Simplified general behavior (fewer windows)
* Added leaderboard (scores are shared :-))
* Fixed a probable bug: the game was intended to run at 72 Hz only. I corrected the code to support any frequency
* Displayed in real time the frequency in the option menu (before it was a fixed 72 Hz value)
* Standardized access to the OPTION menu (accessible with the 'menu' button on the left joystick instead of A or X buttons)
* Removed the RULES button (how to play can be shared through this page)
* A few improvements here and there

NeoPunk
